buttons.create-sync-level: [!]Create & synchronize my level on Level Share Square

html.level-name-placeholder: Du kannst dies später noch ändern
html.import-code-placeholder: Kopiere deinen Level Code hier, drücke dann den LADEN Knopf.

text.gamestyle-notice: Wähle einen Stil! In diesem Spiel versucht jeder Spielstil die Originalquelle detailiert zu replizieren. Daher sind Spielstile nicht miteinander kompatibel. Denke also darüber nach, welchen Spielstil du nun wählen möchtest.
text.theme-notice:
Wähle nun ein Thema und einen Namen für dein Level!
Diese kannst du später ändern. Themas können im Editor verändert werden.
text.cloud-backup-need-login: [!]You are not logged into Level Share Square. With an account, you can enable cloud backups for your level.
text.delete-warning:
Bist du sicher, dass du dieses Level löschen möchtest?
Speichere deinen Level Code zuerst, falls du dein Level später nochmal editieren oder spielen möchtest.
text.code-notice: Teile diesen Level Code mit anderen Spielern, sodass diese dein Level spielen können! Es wird außerdem empfohlen, deinen Level Code separat zu speichern.
text.compact-notice: Kompakte Level Codes beinhalten nur die Daten, welche notwendig sind, um dein Level zu konstruieren. Somit werden spezifische Daten zu dem Bau des Levels nicht gesehen werden können.
text.production-notice: Der Produktionscode deines Levels enthält extra Daten, welche nützlich während des Designs des Levels sein könnten. Zum Beispiel können die Items in der Favoritenleiste betrachtet werden, die während dem Bau des Levels benutzt worden sind.
text.import-code-notice: Kopiere deinen Level Code hier, um dein Level in dem Spiel selbst zu speichern. Trotzdem sollten von dir reguläre Sicherungskopien erschaffen werden, welche separat auf deinem System oder auf Level Share Square gespeichert werden.
text.first-paste-code: [!]You first have to paste in your level code.
text.unrecognized-code: [!]Sorry, this level code could not be recognized.
text.outdated-version: [!]This level code is intended for a newer version of Super Mario Construct.
text.missing-startpoint: [!]The startpoint is invalid. Notify the creator to place a startpoint in an existing map.

labels.no-desc: Für dieses Level gibt es keine Beschreibung.

html.level-code-placeholder: Kopiere einen Level Code hier und drücke LADEN!

tileset-menu.footer:
Klicke auf ein Blockbausatz Symbol, um dessen Seite zu öffnen.[scale=0.5]

[/scale]Ziehe ein Blockbausatz Symbol auf die Favoritenleiste, um den Blockbausatz jederzeit im Editor öffnen zu können.

mini-toolbar.backup-settings:
Sicherungskopie Einstellungen
[scale=0.5](Bezieht sich auf jedes Level)[/scale]

labels.delete-destination-prompt:
Lösche Zielpunkt?
[scale=0.5](Löscht auch die verbundenen Startpunkte)[/scale]
labels.loop-point-notice: [scale=0.6]Halte SHIFT, um den Wiederholungspunkt zu testen[/scale]
labels.restore-point-info:
[scale=0.5][color=#CCCCCC]Wiederherstellungspunkte sind Sicherungskopien deines Levels, welche automatisch hergestellt werden, wenn dein Level seit einer geraumen Zeit nicht mehr gespeichert worden ist.
Du kannst hier zu einer älteren Version deines Level zurückkehren, indem du einen der Wiederherstellungpunkte benutzt.[/background][/scale]

buttons.new-destination: Klicke, um einen neuen Zielpunkt hinzuzufügen
buttons.music-water-muffle:
[scale=0.65]Dämpfe Audio, falls 
der Spieler sich im Wasser befindet.[/scale]
buttons.autosave-notif:
Benachrichtige mich, wenn
automatisch gespeichert worden ist
buttons.prompt-backup-notice:
[scale=0.75]Veranlasse es, alle ... eine Sicherungskopie herunterzuladen[/scale]
[scale=0.5][color=#CCCCCC](Empfohlen auf der Web-Version von SMC)[/color][/scale]

tooltips.conveyor-speed:
[!]Movement speed & direction of the conveyor belts, from the perspective of sprites standing on top.
[sub]There can be multiple conveyor belts with different speeds/directions.[/sub]
tooltips.destination-layer-output-info: Die Levelschicht, auf welcher die Spieler platziert werden. (Währen eine Röhre verlassen wird, werden sie zunächst auf die Levelschicht des Zielpunktes platziert, dann auf die ausgewählte Levelschicht).
tooltips.test-level-from-destination: Teste das Level von diesem Zielpunkt aus
tooltips.layer-tags: Optionale Etiketten, welche sich auf diese Levelschicht beziehen. Levelschichten können mehrere Etiketten haben (Getrennt von einem Leerzeichen) und auch welche miteinander teilen.
tooltips.layer-darkness:
Fügt ein Dunkelheitsoverlay hinzu, welches die Levelschichten under dieser beeinflusst.
Globale Dunkelheit kann in den [color=#F7F76D]Teilbereich Effekten[/color] gefunden werden.
tooltips.water-mode: Falls dies auf immer gestellt worden ist, dann werden Sprites sich so verhalten, als wären sie immer im Wasser.
tooltips.screenwrap: Falls dies aktiviert ist, dann werden die Spieler (und andere Sprites) sich auf die andere Seite des Bildschirms teleportieren, wenn sie die Grenzen des Levels verlassen.
tooltips.allow-camera-control: [!]Allows the player to slightly nudge the camera during gameplay.
tooltips.map-screen-size:
[!]You can customize the screen size of each map.
[sub]Smaller screen sizes will have added black borders, sprites below these are considered out-of-bounds.[/sub]
tooltips.sync-rotating-sprites: [!]When enabled, sprites that rotate around a center point (e.g. {0} or {1}) will always be moving, even when off-screen.
tooltips.disable-offscreen-indicators:
[!]Enable this setting to never make off-screen indicators appear, even if the player has them enabled.
[sub]Try only using this when suitable, to keep accessibility in mind.[/sub]
tooltips.bg-loop-notice: Die meisten Hintergründe sollten sich nur horizontal wiederholen, aber es gibt auch Hintergründe, welche sich vertikal wiederholen können (z.B. Schloss Inneres). Du kannst diese Einstellungen hier verändern.
tooltips.text-formatting:
[scale=0.8]Du kannst Text mit BBCodes umwickeln, um deren Erscheinung zu verändern.

[color=#58A8F0][[][/]color=#cc0000][/color][color=#cc0000]Text Farbe[/color][color=#58A8F0][[][/]/color][/color]
[color=#58A8F0][[][/]background=#ff00ff][/color][background=#ff00ff]Hintergrund Farbe[/background][color=#58A8F0][[][/]/background][/color]

[color=#58A8F0][[][/]scale=0.5][/color][scale=0.5]Skaliere Text[/scale][color=#58A8F0][[][/]/scale][/color]
[/offsety][/scale]
tooltips.favorites-bar:
Die Favoritenleiste erlaubt es dir, oft benutzte Objekte zu lagern/greifen. Sie ist immer in der Werkzeugleiste verfügbar, aber du kannst sie während des Editierens ausschalten.
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]Abkürzungstaste für das Ein-/Ausschalten: F[/color][/scale]
tooltips.mini-toolbar:
Diese kleinere Werkzeugleiste ist immer sichtbar falls eingeschaltet, und sie erlaubt es dir, hauptsächlich Levelschichten schnell zu wechseln.
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]Abkürzungstaste für das Ein-/Ausschalten: M[/color][/scale]
tooltips.inactive-layer-opacity: Falls du eine Blocklevelschicht editierst, dann werden alle andere Levelschichten durchsichtig. 100 wird dies austellen und 0 wird alle Levelschichten vollständig unsichtbar machen.
tooltips.trail-tool-frame-count:
Während du dein Level testest, kann Mario eine Spur im Editor hinterlassen. Diese Anzahl steht für wie viele Einzelbilder Mario hinterlassen wird.
Das Spurenwerkzeug ist in dem Werkzeugkasten unten links während du dein Level testest.
tooltips.backup-interval-notice: Dies ist nicht in Echtzeit, sondern in Zeit, welche im Editor verbracht worden ist.

html.1_water-modes: Aus|Immer (Benötigt keine zusätzlichen Wasserblöcke)|Geschichtetes Wasser (Klassisch)|Geschichtetes Wasser (Modern)
html.bg-loop-methods: Aus|Wickele horizontal|Wickele vertikal|Wickele beide|Wickele keine|Nur horizontal|Nur vertikal
html.bg-scroll-speed-h: ←← SEHR schnell|← Schnell|← Normal|← Langsam|[!]← Minimal|Aus|[!]→ Minimal|→ Langsam|→ Normal|→ Schnell|→→ SEHR schnell
html.bg-scroll-speed-v: ↑↑ SEHR schnell|↑ Schnell|↑ Normal|↑ Langsam|[!]↑ Minimal|Aus|[!]↓ Minimal|↓ Langsam|↓ Normal|↓ Schnell|↓↓ SEHR schnell
html.level-desc-placeholder: Füge eine optionale Zusammenfassung deines Levels hinzu (z.B. Die Handlung, nützliche Informationen, etc.).
html.editor-music: Keine (Still)|Level Musik|Level Musik (gedämpft)|★ Cycle custom BGM (each day)|♪ Brothers At Home (Custom BGM #1)|♪ Morning Drive (Custom BGM #2)|♪ Lunch Break (Custom BGM #3)|♪ The Road is Full Of Dangers (SMRPG)|♪ Creative Exercise (Mario Paint)

text.obj-pipe: [scale=0.75]Die Röhren auf dieser Seite werden als [/scale]Objekte[scale=0.75] behandelt (nicht als [/scale]Blöcke[scale=0.75]), und gehen somit auf die Objektlevelschicht. Diese Röhren können verlängert werden und außerdem kannst du sie über Zeit wachsen oder schrumpfen lassen.[/scale]
text.pipe-sprite-spawner: [scale=0.75]Dieses unsichtbare Objekt kann Sprites kreieren. Falls du möchtest, dass es Sprites aus einer Röhre erschafft, dann ziehe das Objekt einfach in die Röhre rein! Du solltest alle notwendigen Einstellungen aber schon davor gesetzt haben.[/scale]
text.electric-tiles: [!]These are electric tiles that can hurt most organic creatures. Metallic sprites are temporally able to conduct electricity, including Metal Mario!
text.escalators: [!]Note: each escalator should consist of the same slope tile, and should have motor tiles on both ends for proper terrain transitions.
text.scenery-doors: Dies sind dekorative Türen. Falls du nach betretbaren Türen schaust, dann gehe zu dem Warppunkt Menü, indem du auf das Röhrensymbol in der unteren Leiste klickst.
text.advanced-platform:
Fortgeschrittene Platformen
[scale=0.75]Diese Platformen sind sehr anpassbar! Die Blöcke neben ihnen können ihr Verhalten beeinflussen.[/scale]
text.persistent-area-tile: Sprites bleiben in einer von dir ausgewählten Fläche geladen
text.area-object-loader: Lade Sprites in einer von dir ausgewählten Fläche, schon bevor sie auf dem Bildschirm erscheinen
text.tag-tile: Führe Aktionen an etikettierbaren Sprites & Effekten aus
text.light-caster: Erleuchte eine Fläche in der Dunkelheit
text.invis-sprite-spawner: Unsichtbares Objekt, welches Sprites hervorbringt und in Röhren platziert werden kann.
text.current-gen: Erschaffe eine Strömung, welche Sprites zu sich hinzieht oder wegstößt.
text.tag-block: Block, welcher Etikette an- oder ausschaltet.
text.music-changer: [!]Change, start or stop the map's music, with optional fades
text.cheep-cheeps:
Cheep-Cheeps
[scale=0.75]Cheep-Cheeps haben diverse AI Bewegungsmöglichkeiten. Ziehe deine Maus auf deren Symbol, um diese zu überprüfen![/scale]
text.stretch-tiles: [scale=0.75]Scrolle nach unten, um weitere Buu-Lakenblöcke zu sehen![/scale]
text.artillery-tiles:
Verwandte Blöcke
[scale=0.75]Dies sind optionale Blöcke, welche den Objekten oben ähneln.[/scale]
text.king-bill:
König Kugelwilli
[scale=0.75]Dieser kolossale Kugelwilli kann harte Blöcke ohne Probleme zerstören. Außerdem ist er absolut unzerstörbar![/scale]
text.chucks: [!]Chucks have a wide variety of AI modes, including chasing the player, throwing projectiles, or even activating tags!
text.numeric-layer-name-error: [!]Sorry, layer names cannot only consist of numbers.
text.view-map-code: Dies ist dein Teilbereich Code: Er beinhaltet all die Daten zu jenem. Du kannst diesen Code benutzen, um eine identische Kopie von deinem Teilbereich zu einem anderen Level hinzuzufügen. Du kannst aber auch ein Duplikat davon zu diesem Level hinzufügen.
text.import-map-code: Füge einen Teilbereich Code ein. Teilbereich Codes können erhalten werden, indem du den 'Teilen' Knopf auf einem Teilbereich Feld klickst.

sprite-tooltips.green-koopa-flying-no-turn: Grüner fliegender Parakoopa[s]Dreht sich nicht selber um
sprite-tooltips.green-koopa-flying-static: Grüner stationärer Parakoopa[s]Schwebt auf der Stelle
sprite-tooltips.red-koopa-flying-no-turn: Roter fliegender Parakoopa[s]Dreht sich nicht selber um
sprite-tooltips.red-koopa-flying-static: Roter stationärer Parakoopa[s]Schwebt auf der Stelle
sprite-tooltips.blue-koopa-flying: Blauer fliegender Parakoopa[s]Verfolgt den Spieler erbarmungslos
sprite-tooltips.yellow-koopa-flying: Gelber fliegender Parakoopa[s]Nimmt den Spieler in das Visier, um auf ihn zu preschen
sprite-tooltips.bombshell-koopa-flying-no-turn: Fliegender Parakoopeng[s]Dreht sich nicht selber um
sprite-tooltips.beach-koopa-sliding: [!]Sliding Beach Koopa[s]Slides down if placed on slopes
sprite-tooltips.blue-beach-koopa-sliding: [!]Sliding Blue Beach Koopa[s]Slides down if placed on slopes

tile-tooltips.donut-block-2: [!]Pinned Unstable Donut Block[s]Solid, respawns, will fall after shaking
tile-tooltips.donut-block-4: [!]Loose Unstable Donut Block[s]Solid, no-respawn, will fall after shaking
tile-tooltips.donut-block-6: [!]Pinned Unstable Donut Block[s]Semi-solid, respawns, will fall after shaking
tile-tooltips.donut-block-8: [!]Loose Unstable Donut Block[s]Semi-solid, no-respawn, will fall after shaking
tile-tooltips.chomp-post: [!]Chomp Post[s]Place a Chain Chomp on top to attach

tooltips.movement-speed:
[!]Travel speed in pixels / sec.
[sub]One tile equals 16 pixels.[/sub]
tooltips.jump-strength: [!]The initial vertical speed, in pixels / sec, at the start of the jump.
tooltips.blend-modes:
[!]ADDITIVE
[sub]Adds {0}'s colors on top of other overlapping pixels[/sub]

APPEAR ABOVE OBJECTS
[sub]{0} will appear only on objects that are behind him (e.g. on a lower layer.)[/sub]

CAMOUFLAGE
[sub]Same, but is completely invisible and 'cuts through' tiles and sprites![/sub]
tooltips.expanding-obj-cycle-info: [!]Expand and shrink over time, with customization options over the length & durations.
tooltips.expanding-obj-size-change-duration: [!]The time (in seconds) it takes for the expansion/shrinking to complete.
tooltips.expanding-obj-size-change-delay: [!]When it has grown or shrunk, wait this time out before growing/shrinking again
tooltips.period: [!]Time (in seconds) for a complete sine-wave cycle.
tooltips.opacity: [!]Lower opacities can make the sprite less obvious to spot.
tooltips.tagging-info: [!]One or more tags (separated by spaces) to reference this sprite during gameplay.
tooltips.tags-to-activate: [!]One or more tags (separated by spaces) that this sprite can activate.
tooltips.nonstop-projectiles: [!]If enabled, projectiles will keep on being released without ever pausing.
tooltips.projectiles-before-pause: [!]The amount of projectiles to release, before taking a moment to pause.
tooltips.projectile-limit: [!]The maximum amount of projectiles (released by this sprite) that can exist at a time.
tooltips.projectile-limit-ignore:
[!]
[sub]Set to 0 to ignore the projectile limit.[/sub]
tooltips.precise-angle-alternative: [!]You can enter any angle here, from 0-359, if it needs to be more precise than the options the buttons provide.

text.tagging-notice: [!]When ticked off, the spawner can be made active by calling any of its tags (e.g. through a Tag Tile).
text.sinewave-tool: [!]The sinewave angle & amplitude can be set up by dragging the \[---] tool.
text.lock-unlock-direction: [!]Use the arrow button above to lock/unlock the facing direction.
text.quick-and-precise-angle: [!]Use the buttons on the left to quickly set an angle, or use the angle textfield for a precise angle.

tooltips.start-layer: Die Levelschicht, auf wercher der Spieler starten wird.
tooltips.start-powerup: Das Power-Up, mit welchem der Spieler starten wird.

buttons.reset-warp-toggle: Setze diesen Teilbereich zurück, wenn jener betreten wird.

tooltips.warp-name-tips: Gebe diesem {0} einen Namen nach deiner Wahl. Dies wird es dir erlauben, andere {1} einfach zu identifizieren.
tooltips.destination-own-layer:
Die Levelschicht, auf welcher sich dieser Zielpunkt befindet.
Der Spieler wird sich auf dieser Levelschicht befinden, wenn er mit einer Röhre teleportiert wird (Nur während der Animation).
tooltips.destination-output-layer: Dies ist die Levelschicht, auf welcher sich der Spieler auffinden wird, sobald die Warp-Animation beendet ist und er wieder Mario kontrollieren kann.
tooltips.entryway-layer: Dies ist die Levelschicht, auf welcher sich der Startpunkt befindet. Der Spieler wird während der Betretungs-Animation auf dieser Levelschicht sein.

headers.boss-start-common:
[!]When the fight begins...
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]This music will play as soon as {0} is on-screen[/color][/scale]
headers.boss-start-kb:
[!]When the fight begins...
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]This music will play after King Boo's appearance animation[/color][/scale]
headers.boss-defeat-common:
[!]When the fight is over
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]Music to play once {0} is defeated[/color][/scale]
headers.music-changer:
[!]When the player gets in range...
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]This music will play[/color][/scale]

tooltips.music-to-pick: [!]Pick the music that you want to play. This can also be set to not update the music at all.
tooltips.cm-url-info:
[!]With the Custom music option selected, enter a URL in this field to the location of the music file source.

[sub]Note: it must lead directly to the music file, not the page it may be contained in.[/sub]

sines.cycle-duration-info:
[!]Time (in seconds) it takes for a full {0} sine cycle (includes time travelling back).
[sub](This cannot be smaller than half of the magnitude)[/sub]
sines.period-offset-example: [!]Skip ahead to a specific point in the sine cycle, e.g. entering half of the period here will make {0} start on the opposing end of the sine.

labels.tags-entered-below: [!]Tags entered below will trigger or pause when hit.

tooltips.amount-in-block-optional: [!]If the block has an object assigned, it will store a maximum of this value inside.
tooltips.timer-info:
[!]Start a timer when hit for the first time. Once it reaches 0, the block will only have 1 object left.
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]Leave 0 to disable the timer.[/color][/scale]
tooltips.progressive-info: [!]If Mario is small Mario, always give a mushroom, regardless of what item inside.
tooltips.star-chainer-info: [!]When the block is hit when the player has star power, always give a star regardless of what's inside the block.
tooltips.invisible-info: [!]The block cannot be seen initially, but will appear when hit.
tooltips.coins-before-item-info: [!]Release this amount of coins from the block before it dispenses the set item.
tooltips.object-breaks-nearby-player-info: [!]When the player comes near the block, the object inside will break out. When [color=#4CFF00]checked[/color], the timer property is used for the duration of the break animation.
tooltips.tag-block-toggle:
[!]When hitting this block, tags will turn ON or OFF.
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]For example, you can toggle underwater currents with the tag '[color=#58A8F0]switchCurrent[/color]' by also entering '[color=#58A8F0]switchCurrent[/color]' in this field.[/color][/scale]

obj-pipes.resize-options-info: [!]Having this set to always will keep the pipe moving, even if the player isn't nearby. With custom ranges, the pipe will start a cycle only once the player gets in range.

baddie-box.cosmetic-notice: [!]Aside from the larger hitbox, all types are purely cosmetic.
baddie-box.object-cap: [!]Maximum amount of objects, spawned by the box, that can be alive at a time. If enemies spawned by this specific Baddie Box are defeated, it will spawn more.
baddie-box.delays: [!]Spawn delay is the time in seconds between each spawn cycle, start delay is the amount of seconds for the Baddie Box to start the spawn cycle.
baddie-box.launch-velocity: [!]Object velocity when launched out of the Baddie Box.
baddie-box.random-velocity: [!]Optional randomized velocity to add on top of the base velocity (use negative numbers to subtract).
baddie-box.appearances: [!]Baddie Box|Large Baddie Box|Goodie Box|Large Goodie Box

invis-spawner.spawn-delay-info: [!]Time in seconds between each spawn cycle.
invis-spawner.start-delay-info: [!]When the player gets in range, wait this time in seconds before releasing the first object.
invis-spawner.sprite-cap-info:
[!]Maximum amount of objects from the spawner that can be alive at a time. If enemies spawned by this specific spawner are defeated, it will spawn more.
[sub]Enter 0 to have no sprite cap.[/sub]
invis-spawner.tagging-info: [!]One or more tags (separated by spaces) to reference this spawner during gameplay.
invis-spawner.spawn-conditions: [!]When loaded in|When on-screen|When player is in custom range
invis-spawner.spawn-conditions-info: [!]The condition required for the spawner to create new sprites. P-Tiles will also work on option 1.

goal-and-checkpoints.flagpole-hard-block: [!]Whether or not to have the flagpole create an automatic hard block.
goal-and-checkpoints.flagpole-skip-notice: [!]Automatically attempt to prevent the player from jumping over the flagpole by creating an invisible barrier at the top (15 blocks tall).
goal-and-checkpoints.rightwards-pole-layering:
[!]The layering of the pole on the right, typically layered above the player and other sprites.
[sub]You can adjust the layer to account for scenery.[/sub]
goal-and-checkpoints.extend-hitbox-upwards-info:
[!]When the player jumps (up to 15 tiles) above the Goal Tape, the goal will also be activated.
[sub]Tiles above the Goal Tape can prevent this from happening.[/sub]
goal-and-checkpoints.player-respawn-points-info:
[!]You can either use the checkpoint's own draggable target as respawn point, but you can also use a destination as respawn point.
[sub]The latter case is useful for long distances, or for making the player respawn in another map[/sub]
goal-and-checkpoints.respawning-map: [!]The map the player will respawn on after a death.
goal-and-checkpoints.player-respawn-points: [!]Use own respawn point|Use destination as respawn point

bill-blasters.sniper-notice: [!]Sniper cannons will always aim and shoot towards the player.
bill-blasters.fire-rate-notice: [!]How fast the Bill Blaster will shoot its Bullet Bills!
bill-blasters.types-info:
[!]The type of Bullet Bills that this Blaster will shoot.
[sub]Missile Bills will try to home in on the player.[/sub]

cannon.base-info: [!]Optional base sprite that becomes part of the cannon. It's purely visual and does not affect the cannon behavior.
cannon.ammo-info: [!]The ammo that will be fired by the cannon. Cannonballs move in a straight line, Bob-ombs explode shortly after being shot out.
cannon.cannonballs-per-shot-info:
[!]The amount of cannonballs dispensed before moving on to the next rotation.
[sub]Does not apply to Bob-ombs.[/sub]
cannon.delay: [!]The delay between each firing & rotation. Firings happens in the middle between 2 rotations.
cannon.mode-info: [!]The movement of the cannon. The bottom 2 options are not applicable to the stationary setting.
cannon.rotation-count-1: [!]The amount of rotations (getting into the next position) it will do, before reversing and going into the opposite direction.
cannon.rotation-count-2:
[!]The amount of times it can rotate to the left OR right, from its starting position.
[sub]E.g. if set to 2, the cannon can only move to the left twice, and becomes unable to track the player unless it moves back to the right.[/sub]
cannon.rotation-count-disabled: [!]Leave at 0 to have no rotation cap.

advanced-platform.platform-width-info: [!]The width of the platform, in tiles.
advanced-platform.angle-of-movement-info: [!]You can set the angle using the buttons to the left, or enter a more precise angle here for the platform's linear movement, from 0 to 359.
advanced-platform.platform-speed-info:
[!]The speed of the platform's linear movement, in pixels / sec.
[sub]Each tile is 16 pixels, so for example, entering 48 will make the platform move 3 tiles per second.[/sub]
advanced-platform.player-activation-info: [!]When a player steps on a platform, it is possible to activate it and/or perform an action. Check the list of actions below!
advanced-platform.tagging-info:
[!]One or more tags (separated by spaces) to reference this platform during gameplay.
[sub]Using tags, you can enable or disable this platform with e.g. ON/OFF Tag Blocks.[/sub]
advanced-platform.acceleration-info:
[!]Optional time (in seconds) it takes for the platform to reach maximum speed.
[sub]Leave 0 for instant acceleration.[/sub]
advanced-platform.deceleration-info:
[!]Optional time (in seconds) it takes for the platform to come to a full stop.
[sub]Leave 0 for instant deceleration.[/sub]
advanced-platform.angle-change-info:
[!]Change the angle of movement by this value, per second.
[sub]Negative values work too.[/sub]

platform-influencers.tagging-info:
[!]When one or more tags are specified, only platforms with these tags will be affected by this {0}.
[sub]Leave empty to affect all platforms.[/sub]
platform-influencers.turn-type-info:
[!]Instant
[sub]Change the angle of movement instantly. If a delay is given, the platform freezes for the duration of the delay.[/sub]

Smooth
[sub]Smoothly transition to the new direction, moving in a round corner.[/sub]

Slowdown
[sub]The platform slows down, stops, then speeds back up in the new direction.[/sub]
platform-influencers.turn-time-info: [!]Time (in seconds) it takes for a completed turn.
platform-influencers.new-movement-speed-info: [!]New linear movement speed for the platform (in pixels / sec).
platform-influencers.speed-change-time-info: [!]The time (in seconds) it takes for the platform to adjust to its new given speed.
platform-influencers.action-tile-header: [!]When the platform goes over this tile...
platform-influencers.action-tile-delay: [!]Time (in seconds) of waiting, before the action performs.
platform-influencers.action-tile-update:
[!]The action to perform on the platform, after the delay is waited out.
[sub]The 'Nothing' option will cancel any existing action queued, regardless of time.[/sub]
platform-influencers.current-tags-info:
[!]When a platform contains any of the tags specified here, these tags will be edited.
[sub]Leave this field empty to affect all platforms.[/sub]
platform-influencers.tag-updating-method-info: [!]Choose how you want the platform's tag or collection of tags to update.
platform-influencers.tags-to-update-info: [!]The tag(s) you want to insert, replace or remove (depending on the picked option) from the platform.

arrow-signpost.post-info:
[!]Build-in post for the arrow to be attached to.
[sub]If preferred, this can also be done or extended with tiles.[/sub]

npc.speech-bubble-info: [!]Short bit of text, that will be shown in a speech bubble when nearby the NPC.
npc.second-pop-up-msg: [!]Speech bubble text after the player interacted with the NPC.
npc.pop-up-update-info: [!]Remove, keep or replace the existing pop-up message when the player interacts with the NPC.
npc.item-stock-info: [!]Either give an item just once, or give the NPC infinite stock to respawn an item when it gets used up or destroyed.
npc.item-options: [!]Just once|When item is used or destroyed
npc.behavior-info:
[!]The NPC's behavior, in movement and/or animation.
[sub]Each NPC can have different behavioral options, but some can just stay idle only.[/sub]

arrow-cloud.mode-info: [!]The movement of the Arrow Cloud. The bottom 3 options are not applicable to the stationary setting.
arrow-cloud.one-time-usage-info: [!]If a compatible sprite collides with the Arrow Cloud & is re-directed, the Arrow Cloud disappears.
arrow-cloud.can-toss-player-info:
[!]Star Arrow Clouds will always work on the player, and also put them in a tossed state.
[sub]This also makes the player affected by regular Arrow Clouds, so you only need 1 Star Arrow Cloud at the start of a chain.[/sub]
arrow-cloud.tagging-rotation-info: [!]The Arrow Cloud's rotation can be started/stopped with tagging.

chucks.whistling-chuck-info: [!]Aside from alerting & waking up enemies, Whistlin' Chucks can activate tags specified below!
chucks.idle-until-stomped-info: [!]The Chuck will remain idle, until they have been stomped (not defeated) by the player.

labels.king-boo-blend-info: [!]King Boo can blend in with terrain in various ways
labels.attack-frequency-info: [!]It's possible for one attack to occur more often! Check me out:

tooltips.hp-info: [!]HP (Health Points) are the amount of hits needed to take out {0}.
tooltips.attack-cycle-info:
[!]If multiple attacks are enabled, {0} will go through each attack in a random order. After that, a new attack cycle begins, where the attack order is randomized again.

[sub]With the 'attack frequency' option, you can have one or more attacks play out multiple times per cycle![/sub]
tooltips.bb-attack-phase: [!]Boom Boom can either increase his attack phase automatically as he loses HP, or he can stick to one specific phase during the fight.
tooltips.bb-attack-frequency:
[!]More frequent attacks can add more difficulty to the fight, and the stomp opportunity is shorter on the dash attack.
[sub]Note that on the dash attack, even when set to 'Near instant', there is a 1 second opportunity for the player to stomp the boss.[/sub]
tooltips.bb-movement-speed:
[!]Maximum movement speed, in pixels / sec.
[sub]In the final phase (Pinch mode), this is multiplied by 50%[/sub]
tooltips.bb-traction: [!]Higher tractions makes Boom Boom able to turn faster, whilst low tractions make it harder to turn.
tooltips.bb-takeoff-strength:
[!]Jump strength when leaping into the air.
[sub]Note: only used by winged mode.[/sub]
tooltips.bb-wings:
[!]If given wings, Boom Boom is able to fly and dive in on the player.
[sub]When 'Switch when hit' is set, Boom Boom will switch from ground to winged mode (and vice versa) every time he loses HP.[/sub]
tooltips.bw-defeat-events: [!]When Bowser is defeated, this (optional) event gets performed automatically.
tooltips.bw-movement-speed: [!]Bowser's movement speed when walking inbetween attacks, in pixels / sec.
tooltips.bw-walking-mode: [!]Bowser can either stay put or walk around. The patrol area option is useful for e.g. keeping Bowser on a bridge, whereas the final option is designed for large arenas.
tooltips.bw-minimum-jumps: [!]The amount of attacks Bowser has to perform before he has a chance of jumping, the chance of that can be set in the option below.
tooltips.bw-jumping-chance:
[!]Chance of jumping ranging from 0% to 100%.
[sub]0% disables jumping entirely, while 100% guarantees a jump every time.[/sub]
tooltips.bw-attack-speed: [!]The speed of Bowser's attacks, from leisurely spewing fire to wildly swinging hammers!
tooltips.kb-invincibility-period:
[!]Time in seconds before King Boo becomes vulnerable to attacks again, after being hit. King Boo will become transparent during this invincibility phase.
[sub]Enter 0 to skip the invincibility period.[/sub]
tooltips.kb-base-speed:
[!]Base (minimum) movement speed, in pixels / sec.

[sub]King Boo can optionally speed up in darkness with the value defined on the right.[/sub]
tooltips.kb-darkness-boost:
[!]Maximum extra speed that gets added to King Boo when submerged in darkness, in pixels / sec.

[sub]Note that this value is divided by the level of darkness that is covering King Boo's eyes: if the darkness level is 50%, for example, it will add 50% of this speed value on top of the base speed.[/sub]

html.bw-defeat-events: [!]No special events|Level Clear|Walk to nearest NPC
html.bw-intro-animations: [!]None|Jump from below|Jump out Clown Copter|Disguise as Peach

text.bw-attack-desc-flame: [!]Spews one or more flames towards the player's direction
text.bw-attack-desc-mecha-wand: [!]Bowser uses his wand to spawn Mechakoopas. But you can use these against him!
text.bw-attack-desc-shell-dash: [!]Bowser hides in his shell, which will then spin around rapidly. Watch your step!
text.kb-attack-desc-flame: [!]Spews out a ghostly flame towards the player
text.kb-attack-desc-dash: [!]Targets and homes in on the player
text.kb-attack-desc-bottle: [!]Releases multiple Magic Bottles. Some burst into flames, one will release a fairy when stomped to stun King Boo!
text.kb-attack-desc-pepper: [!]Spits out pumpkins and a pepper. Throw the pepper back at the mouth to make King Boo vulnerable to pumpkins!
text.kb-attack-desc-ring: [!]Create a ring of flames around King Boo, that protect him from projectiles
text.boss-intro-anim-info: [!]{0} can enter in style! Pick an intro animation of your liking.
text.disguised-enemy: [!]An enemy can disguise as Bowser! Their disguise is revealed on defeat.
text.intro-anim-unavailable: [!]Intro animations for this boss are currently unavailable in this gamestyle.

mapsnap.default-info:
[!]Less errors, but usually has a larger image resolution and a larger filesize. 

 Images taken of maps with a level width or level height above 510 blocks will have incomplete data.
mapsnap.fixed-info:
[!]More errors, but usually has a smaller image resolution and a smaller filesize. 

 Images taken of maps with a level width or level height above 1020 blocks will have reduced image quality.

labels.close-menu-to-return: Schließe Menü, um zum Spiel zurückzukehren
labels.recorder-quality-notice: [!]Low quality is fast, high quality takes up more space and requires a powerful enough device.
labels.log-out-confirmation: Bist du sicher, dass du dich ausloggen möchtest?
labels.offline-notice: Du bist offline. LSS Features sind somit nicht verfügbar.

tooltips.camera-keybinds:
[!]Gameplay camera keybinds
[sub]Camera may not always be scrollable[/sub]
tooltips.frame-skip:
Überspringe Einzelbilder (Frames) wenn die Bildrate niedrig ist, um eine Verlangsamung des Spieles zu vermeiden.
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]Bei sehr niedrigen Bildraten können Kollisionsfehler auftauchen. Ohne das Überspringen der Einzelbilder wird eine Verlangsamung bei einer Bildrate von unter 60 FPS geschehen.[/color][/scale=0.75]
tooltips.reduced-particles: Erzwinge eine strengere Limitation bei Partikeln mit komplexeren Bewegungen (32 statt 128)

menu.pick-theme: Klicke hier um ein Thema zu wählen!

tooltips.name: [!]A name to identify this effect, purely inside the editor.
tooltips.tags: Optionale(es) Etikett(en) (Getrennt von Leerzeichen), welche(s) sich auf diesen Effekt bezieh(t/en). Du kannst z.B. einen Etikettenblock benutzen, um diesen Effekt an-/auszuschalten.
tooltips.intensity: Intensität dieses Effektes. Höhere Einstellungen resultieren meistens in mehr Partikel.[/color]
tooltips.downfall-tilt: Simuliere Wind, indem sich abwärtsbewegende Partikel etwas nach links oder rechts bewegen.
tooltips.upwards-tilt: Simuliere Wind, indem sich aufwärtsbewegende Partikel etwas nach links oder rechts bewegen.
tooltips.environment-collisions: Sich abwärtsbewegende Partikel werden nicht mit der Umgebung kollidieren (Blöcke, Wasser, etc.) falls dieses Feld aktiviert ist.
tooltips.movement-speed:
Partikel/Overlay Bewegungsgeschwindigkeit (In Pixel/Sek.)
[scale=0.75][color=CCCCCC]Jeder Block ist 16x16 Pixel groß[/color][/scale]
tooltips.flash-type:
Hintergrund: Blitze die Farbenschicht im Hintergrund. Nützlich für innere Gegenden mit Fenstern.
Alle Levelschichten: Nützlich für äußere Gegenden, da der Blitz auf jeder Levelschicht erscheinen wird.
tooltips.toggle-sfx: Schalte diesen SFX ein oder aus.
tooltips.opacity: Intensität dieses Effektes. Sie reicht von sehr durchsichtig zu undurchsichtig.
tooltips.fade-duration: Die Zeit (In Sekunden), welche der Effekt benötigt, um ein-/auszublenden, wenn einer seiner Ettikette aktiviert/deaktiviert worden ist.
tooltips.additive-blend: Die Additive Mischung fügt die Farben des Overlays über die Pixel hinzu, welche das Overlay überdeckt. Dieser Effekt ist mit hellen Farben einfacher bemerkbar.
tooltips.color-hex:
Benutzerdefinierte Farbe im HEX Format.

Beispiele:
[scale=0.75][color=#C8C8C8]C8C8C8 für Hellgrau[/color]
[color=#F8C0F0]F8C0F0 für Pastell-Rosa[/color][scale=0.5][/scale]

Es wird empfohlen, sich einen Farbenwähler online zu suchen, damit die bevorzugten HEX-Farben gefunden werden können.[/scale]
tooltips.palette: Palette dieses Effektes, welche rein kosmetisch ist.
tooltips.two-way-movement: [!]Allows particles to also move towards the opposite angle.
tooltips.water-check: [!]Each effect particle will check if it is inside water. If it isn't, it may disappear or start moving elsewhere.
tooltips.water-check-player: [!]The effect will differ depending on if the player is inside a liquid or not.
tooltips.affected-audio: [!]Whether to affect just sound effects, music, or both.
tooltips.volume-reduction: [!]The amount of decibells to lower the volume with.
tooltips.wind-strength: [!]The strength of the wind, stronger strengths will make sprites get pushed faster.
tooltips.wind-buildup: [!]The time in seconds for the wind to build up to full speed (and vice-versa).
tooltips.wind-duration: [!]The duration of the wind blowing (note: this does not include buildup time).
tooltips.wind-cooldown: [!]Time in seconds for the wind to cool down to zero.
tooltips.wind-cycle-delay: [!]Time in seconds between a wind cycle (cooldown end - buildup start).
tooltips.wind-repeats: [!]The amount of time the wind will repeat its cycle. The delay between winds is the same as the duration.

palettes.1_rain: Standard Regen|Radioaktiver Abfall|Matschige Gülle|Dschungel Saft|Abwasser Suppe|Tiefe Dunkelheit|Silbener Fall|Träumerische Tropfen
palettes.2_rain: Standard Regen|Toxische Säure|Zähflüssiger Schlamm|Frostige Kryoflüssigkeit|Schokoladengetränk|Ölpest|Goldene Dusche|Geschmolzenes Metal|Giftiger Modder|Monochrome Mischung
palettes.1_embers: Standard Glut|Sengende Seuche|Lila Leere|Scharfer Saphir|Katastrophales Karmesin|Tödlicher Teer|Goldene Gefahr|Grünes Gift
palettes.2_embers: Standard Glut|Finsteres Schwarz|Giftiges Lila|Substanz der Nichtigkeit|Tintenblau|Royales Gold
palettes.1_leaf: Standard Blätter|Roter Herbst|Gelbe Trockenheit|Weißer Winter|Grüner Sommer|Limettengrüner Frühling|Violette Mitternacht|Brennende Blüte
palettes.2_leaf: Standard Blätter|Standard Herbst|Outrageous Laubwerk|Illusionäres Grau|Knackige Schokolade|Funky Lila|Aschiger Pinsel|Grelles Grau|Finsterer Sumpf|Goldene Entzückung|Der frühe Winter|Knuspriger Kakao|Ruhiger Sonnenuntergang|Brütende Brise|Farblose Fauna

text.duplicate-name: Dieser Effektname ist bereits in Benutzung. Versuche einen anderen Namen.

restore-points.header: In diesem Menü kannst du eine Sicherungskopie von einer älteren Version deines Levels wiederherstellen und/oder herunterladen.
restore-points.none-found:
Es gibt für dieses Level noch keine Wiederherstellungspunkte.
Wiederherstellungspunkte werden automatisch kreiert, während du Zeit in diesem Level verbringst.
restore-points.confirm-prompt: Möchtest du von diesem Datum wiederherstellen?

startpoint-missing.message-edit:
Einen Moment mal - Dieses Level hat im Moment keinen Startpunkt! Dies ist wahrscheinlich passiert, weil der Teilbereich mit dem Startpunkt gelöscht worden ist.

Möchtest du nun einen neuen Startpunkt setzen?
startpoint-missing.message-play: Einen Moment mal! Dieses Level hat keinen gültigen Startpunkt - Gehe in den Editor, öffne die Einstellungen, und platziere einen Startpunkt von dort aus.

level-sync-new.enter-link: [!]Enter the link to your level on Level Share Square that you want to synchronize the level code with.
level-sync-new.info-label-1: [!]With this feature enabled, when you save your level in-game, it will also be updated on the Level Share Square website automatically.
level-sync-new.info-label-2: [!]When opening up the editor, the game will also alert you if the level code on the site is newer, which is useful when editing on multiple devices.
level-sync-new.sync-success: [!]Your level is synchronized with its entry on Level Share Square! Huzzah!

level-sync-edit.sync-options: [!]Pause synchronization|Whenever the game saves|When I exit out of the editor
level-sync-edit.cancel-notice-1: [!]When you cancel synchronization, the game will stop communication between Level Share Square for this specific level.
level-sync-edit.cancel-notice-2: [!]De-synchronizing does not delete your level either in-game or on Level Share Square. You can always re-enable synchronization at a later date.
level-sync-edit.sync-cancelled: [!]This level is no longer being synchronized with Level Share Square.

level-sync-compare.new-ver-on-site: [!]It looks like a newer version of this level is on Level Share Square. Would you like to synchronize?
level-sync-compare.restore-point-notice: [!]A local restore point will be made in case you want to go back.

tip-notifs.tile-rotation: [!]This tileset supports tile rotation! Press CTRL to rotate tiles.
tip-notifs.tile-rotation-ship-1: [!]Screws, spikes, tank treads & propellers can be rotated with CTRL!
tip-notifs.tile-rotation-ship-2: [!]Screws, tank treads & propellers can be rotated with CTRL!
tip-notifs.icy-palette: [!]This palette is icy, sprites can have slippery physics!
tip-notifs.obj-digging-chuck: [!]Diggin' Chucks can dig up boulders, meteors, or snowballs. Avoid placing this sprite on or near slopes, they are only designed for flat terrain.
tip-notifs.obj-whistling-chuck: [!]Whistlin' Chucks can wake up sleeping enemies, as well as make sprites break out of Mole Holes & Flip Blocks. They can also activate tags!

music-manager.remove-music-warning: [!]This will remove music only for this category.
music-manager.npc-play-prompts: [!]Excellent choice!|I'm BOPPING to this!|This is my jam!
music-manager.timed-custom-music-notice: [!]If you add custom music, you'll able to pick them here.
music-manager.custom-music-tab-header: [!]Here, you can add and manage your custom music for this level. You will find your custom music as pickable options in the prior tab.
music-manager.custom-music-tab-help: [!]The name of your music is purely for identification. The loop point is the time in seconds your music restarts at. Optionally, you can adjust your music's volume.
music-manager.custom-music-delete-prompt:
[!]Press here to confirm you want to delete this custom music.
[scale=0.5][color=#CCCCCC]Note: this will also remove it from maps and timers.[/color][/scale]

other-notifs.recording-ready: [!]The recording is ready. Download the video?
other-notifs.download-level-backup-prompt-1: [!]Would you like to download this level to your file system as a backup?
other-notifs.download-level-backup-prompt-2: [!]You can edit these prompts in the backup settings.
other-notifs.level-restored-prev-ver: [!]Level has been restored to a previous version!
other-notifs.visit-level-list: [!]Would you like to visit your level list?
